verses.text: Behold, I \add will\add* send my messenger, and he shall prepare the way before me: And the Lord, whom ye seek, shall suddenly come to his temple, Even the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in: Behold, he \add shall\add* come, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
But who \add may\add* abide the day of his coming? And who \add shall\add* stand when he appeareth? For he \add is\add* like a refiner’s fire, and like fullers’ sope:

And he shall sit \add as\add* a refiner and purifier of silver: And he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver, That they may offer unto the \sc Lord\sc* an offering in righteousness.
Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the \sc Lord\sc*, As \add in\add* the days of old, and as \add in\add* former years.

And I will come near to you to judgment; And I will be a swift witness Against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, And against those that oppress the hireling in \add his\add* wages, The widow, and the fatherless, And that turn aside the stranger \add from his right\add*, and fear not me, Saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
For I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, I change not; Therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.

Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept \add them\add*. Return unto me, and I will return unto you, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts. But ye said, Wherein shall we return?
Will a man rob God? Yet ye \add have\add* robbed me. But ye say, Wherein have we robbed thee? \add In\add* tithes and offerings.
Ye \add are\add* cursed with a curse: for ye \add have\add* robbed me, \add Even\add* this whole nation.

Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, That there may be meat in mine house, And prove me now herewith, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, If I will not open you the windows of heaven, And pour you out a blessing, that \add there shall\add* not \add be room\add* enough \add to receive it\add*.

And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, And he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; Neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the field, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
And all nations shall call you blessed: For ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
Your words have been stout against me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*. Yet ye say, What have we spoken so much against thee?
Ye have said, It \add is\add* vain to serve God: And what profit \add is it\add* that we have kept his ordinance, And that we have walked mournfully before the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts?
And now we call the proud happy; Yea, they that work wickedness are set up; Yea, \add they that\add* tempt God are even delivered.

Then they that feared the \sc Lord\sc* spake often one to another: And the \sc Lord\sc* hearkened, and heard \add it\add*, And a book of remembrance was written before him For them that feared the \sc Lord\sc*, and that thought upon his name.
And they shall be mine, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, In that day when I make \add up my\add* jewels; And I will spare them, as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.
Then shall ye return, and discern between the righteous and the wicked, Between him that serveth God and \add him\add* that serveth him not.
